page.title: 09WILDLIFE CENTER
page.content: Under the auspices of the Economic Forestry Group a small museum, the Burncleuch Forest Centre, has been established. Its objective being to act as a centre of information for visitors ,forest owners , students and school children. Information is provided on the forest and wildlife work undertaken in Eskdalemuir and surrounding districts. The museum also serves as a teaching centre where students from various countrys are instructed on aspects of forestry conservation and ecology. There is another teaching center at Raeburnhead situated at the head of a tributary of the River Esk this building is also an Outward Bound Centre.
